result.execSummary:
The defendant CHARLES C JONES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 10 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 10:46 AM Defendant CHARLES C JONES in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mark Muza in court for CHARLES C JONES.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement entered onto court record = plea to Ct 1 - 2 years probation, Defense free to argue.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with. Parties waive right to PreSentence Investigation Report.  Sentencing arguments made by parties.  Def. argues for time served = 34 days credit.
